hints.label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
hints.title: Boundary Potential Contraction Under Cloning
hints.content:
7291: :label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
7292: 
7293: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4) including the Safe Harbor Axiom (Axiom 4.3), there exist constants $\kappa_b > 0$ and $C_b < \infty$, both independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
7294: 
7295: $$
7296: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_b) W_b(S_1, S_2) + C_b
7297: $$
7298: 
7299: Furthermore, when $W_b(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_b$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_b$, the contraction becomes strict:
7300: 
7301: $$
7302: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) - W_b(S_1, S_2)] < 0
hints.raw_directive:
7288: ## 11.3. Main Theorem: Boundary Potential Contraction
7289: 
7290: :::{prf:theorem} Boundary Potential Contraction Under Cloning
7291: :label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
7292: 
7293: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4) including the Safe Harbor Axiom (Axiom 4.3), there exist constants $\kappa_b > 0$ and $C_b < \infty$, both independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
7294: 
7295: $$
7296: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_b) W_b(S_1, S_2) + C_b
7297: $$
7298: 
7299: Furthermore, when $W_b(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_b$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_b$, the contraction becomes strict:
7300: 
7301: $$
7302: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) - W_b(S_1, S_2)] < 0
7303: $$

hints.label: rem-progressive-safety
hints.title: Interpretation: Progressive Safety Enhancement
hints.content:
7308: :label: rem-progressive-safety
7309: 
7310: This theorem formalizes the Safe Harbor mechanism:
7311: 
7312: - **When many walkers are near the boundary** ($W_b$ large), these walkers have low fitness and high cloning probability
7313: - **They are replaced by clones of interior walkers**, pulling the boundary potential down

7307: :::{prf:remark} Interpretation: Progressive Safety Enhancement
7308: :label: rem-progressive-safety
7309: 
7310: This theorem formalizes the Safe Harbor mechanism:
7311: 
7312: - **When many walkers are near the boundary** ($W_b$ large), these walkers have low fitness and high cloning probability
7313: - **They are replaced by clones of interior walkers**, pulling the boundary potential down
7314: - **The contraction rate $\kappa_b$ is state-independent**, ensuring consistent safety correction regardless of swarm configuration
